descriptionModule.briefSummary: The overarching aim of this proposal is to experimentally test whether a mindfulness intervention improves relationship quality. Romantic couples from the community will be randomly assigned to one of two arms: mindfulness vs. active control. Both interventions will be completed on a smart-phone for 14 days using identical intervention activities as our existing published research. After the 14-day period, couples will attend a lab visit and provide relationship quality data.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Romantic couples from the community will be randomly assigned to one of two arms: mindfulness vs. active control. Thus, both partners will either complete the mindfulness intervention (developed to increase attention towards and acceptance of current experiences) or a relaxation-based active treatment comparison intervention (developed to parallel the structure of the mindfulness intervention without the attention towards or acceptance of present experiences). Both interventions will be completed on a smart-phone for 14 days using identical intervention activities as our existing published research, which demonstrated that the mindfulness intervention reduced stress reactivity and improved daily well-being. After the 14-day period, couples will attend a lab visit and provide multi-method relationship quality data.

conditions: The Focus of the Study is Romantic Relationship Quality

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: There are 2 arms to this intervention - mindfulness and active control.

maskingInfo.maskingDescription: The participant and the people interacting with participants will be blind to condition.

armGroups.label: MIndfulness
armGroups.description: This arm was developed to increase attention towards and acceptance of current experiences.

armGroups.label: Active Control
armGroups.description: This arm is a relaxation-based active treatment comparison intervention, developed to parallel the structure of the mindfulness intervention without the attention towards or acceptance of present experiences.

interventions.name: Mindfulness intervention
interventions.description: Participants will either complete a mindfulness intervention or active control for 2 weeks on their smartphone

primaryOutcomes.description: Assessed with well validated sel-report questionnaire, the Couples Satisfaction Index
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before and after the 2 week intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed with well validated measure, the PROMIS sleep disturbance questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before and after the 2 week intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed with well validated measure, the PROMIS depressive symptoms questionnire
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before and after the 2 week intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed with well validated measure, physiological assessment via a blood pressure machine
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before and after the 2 week intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: Assessed with well validated measure, the Life Satisfaction Scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Before and after the 2 week intervention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Couples living together for at least 2 years
* Both partners must be fluent in English
* Both partners cannot already engage in regular systematic mind-body practice (\>2 times per week).
* Both partners must have daily access to an internet-enabled smartphone to complete the intervention

Exclusion Criteria:

-
